7393.quoteText:
Governing Law and Jurisdiction

The Roll20 service (excluding linked sites) is controlled by The Orr Group, LLC from its offices within the state of Kansas, United States of America. By accessing Roll20, you agree that all matters relating to your access to, or use of, Roll20 shall be governed by the statutes and laws of the State of Kansas, without regard to the conflicts of laws principles thereof. The parties specifically disclaim the U.N. Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods. You also agree and hereby submit to the exclusive personal jurisdiction and venue of the Superior Court of Sedgwick County and the United States District Court for the 18th Judicial District of Kansas with respect to such matters.
7393.title: The court of law governing the terms is in location X

tosdr.case: The court of law governing the terms is in location X

7397.quoteText:
We might give access to US authorities if requested in writing.
We’ll try not to, but we don’t have the resources to fight the government.
We’ll also keep the account owner informed as much as we can if this happens.
7397.title: The service promises to inform and/or notify users regarding government inquiries that may involve users' personal data

tosdr.case: The service promises to inform and/or notify users regarding government inquiries that may involve users' personal data

7398.quoteText: Content that you upload to the Roll20 Marketplace remains the IP of the original creator, and becomes subject to the additional terms found in the Marketplace End User Licese Agreement (EULA).

tosdr.case: You maintain ownership of your data

7401.quoteText:
Breach of Terms

If you breach any of the terms and conditions in this document, your authorization to access or use Roll20 automatically terminates.
7401.title: User accounts can be terminated after having been in breach of the terms of service repeatedly

tosdr.case: User accounts can be terminated after having been in breach of the terms of service repeatedly

7402.quoteText: It is your sole responsibility to keep your email, password and other sensitive information confidential.

7403.quoteText: Any assets that you upload to the Roll20 Marketplace will also be made public under the license that you select when the asset is submitted.

7406.quoteText:
Orr Group does not pre-screen user materials that users provide or otherwise submit via Roll20.
however, Orr Group may remove any posted or submitted user materials from Roll20 for any reason without notice in its sole discretion.

7407.quoteText:
Reliability Do you guarantee that Roll20 will be accessible at all times?

In short, we do not. Like all other cloud-based applications, we are vulnerable to the inherent unreliability of the Internet.

Use or attempt to gain access to or use another’s user or company account, password, data, or computer systems or networks connected to any Roll20 server, whether through hacking, password mining or any other means.

7414.quoteText:
Notification of Copyright Infringement (DMCA Policy)

Orr Group will, in appropriate circumstances, terminate the accounts of users who infringe the intellectual property rights of others. Orr Group will investigate notices of copyright infringement and take appropriate actions under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, Title 17, United States Code, Section 512(c)(2) (“DMCA”).

Restriction and Termination of Use

Orr Group may block, restrict, disable, suspend or terminate your access to all or part of Roll20 at any time in Orr Group’s sole discretion, without prior notice or liability to you.
